ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Fletchers] HELP!
ygData.msgSnippet: The increases were slow for the first 5 points (took at least two backpacks full per point), but they seemed to pick up after that.  From 193 to 197 actually
ygData.messageBody:
The increases were slow for the first 5 points (took at least two backpacks
full per point), but they "seemed" to pick up after that. From 193 to 197
actually took only 2 backpacks total to get. The last few points, however,
again took 3+ backpacks each point to gain. I did notice major
success/failure differences when I upped my Wisdom some. I also put on
some Int gear to help with the learning of the skill. Best advise I can
give is to get as much Wis and Int gear as you can when you work on your
fletching. The increased Wis will allow you to succeed more (thus costing
less in failures), and the increased Int will save your wrists some pain
since your skill will increase (slightly) faster.

As far as what to make, stick with Ceramic vane arrows. They do not go
trivial and they are the only arrow I know of that makes a profit. If you
can get your skill up and make a profit at the same time, I say go for it. :)

Good luck on the Darkwood Bow. After I reached a fletching skill of 200, I
immediately attempted to make a Compound Darkwood Bow. I failed the first
two tries. On the third try I was successful (thank goodness). This just
goes to show that even though the skill is maxed out, it is not guaranteed
that you will succeed every time.

Belzarak





> >I noticed the same thing when I was getting my fletching up. However, I
> >did eventually get my fletching to 200 on Ceramic vane arrows. After I
> >hit 187 (seems its a random spot for each person), it took 5 backpacks
> >full before I saw a skill increase. The going was definantly slow, but it
> >did eventually go up. The only consolance I can offer is that the
> >ceramic vane arrows actually sell back to the vendor for more than the
> >cost of the parts. I ended up making a 250plat profit from working to
> >get my fletching up.
> >
> >
> >Just my 2copper.
> >
> >Belzarak Bladedancer
>
> Yes, I noticed that too. When I sold back the ceramic vane arrows I
>got a profit (sold for like 6gp + per arrow). However, when I moved to the
>next component up, which is steel shafts, the arrows actually sold for less
>(like 5gp + per arrow) =/. But you say you did get to 200 with ceramic vane
>only? Well then I'll switch back to that ... because buying all of the most
>expensive components is just soooo expensive to do. Did it take you 5
>backpacks or so of components to get each level increase from then on? Or
>was it just when you hit 187, and then got easier from then on? Because I
>am NOT looking forward to fletching all those arrows =P. But oh well, gotta
>keep reminding myself ... want to make darkwood ... WANT to make darkwood!
>=) But thank you all ever so much for the input ... guess I'll go back to
>fletching those arrows now *wimpers*
>
>Tira Misu of Lanys T'vyl
